utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, are you in the shower?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t hear you, I’m in the shower.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I asked if you were in the shower, but that’s moot now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Moot. Rendered unimportant by recent events.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t hear you, I’m in the shower.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have to skip the chitchat. Emergency.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What kind of emergency?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mathematical. 32-ounce banana smoothie, 16-ounce bladder.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You might not want to do that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I assure you I do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m not alone in here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing in there? She can’t be in here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We were in here first, you can’t be in here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: According to the roommate agreement, paragraph nine, subsection B, the right to bathroom privacy is suspended in the event of force majeure. And believe me, I am experiencing a very majeure force.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come on, you can’t wait two minutes?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard, let the man pee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny? Penny? Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Move. Move. Move!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dr. Leonard Hofstadter, you are officially charged with two violations of the roommate agreement. Do you waive reading of the charges?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, fine.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Hang on. No, my client does not waive reading of the charges.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Cool. I’ve got a lawyer. And I’ve seen her naked.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Proceed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well. Count the first, on or about the 28th day of April, the accused did knowingly and with malice aforethought deny access to the shared bathroom in a time of emergency, to wit, my back teeth were floating. Count the second, the accused exceeded the agreed upon occupancy of the shower, to wit, one, unless we are under attack by water-soluble aliens.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Can I see the roommate agreement?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um, it’s fairly technical.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I think I can handle it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Top of her class, Cambridge University. Licensed to practice law in three countries. And your face.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: All right, based on a cursory reading, it doesn’t look like you have much of a case, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do so, do so.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, I’m afraid not. Section seven here, on the right to enter the bathroom in emergency situations, is not specific as to what constitutes an emergency.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s ridiculous. A bathroom emergency is self-explanatory.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Is it? If Leonard forgot to trim his nose hair, could he barge in while you were showering?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Irrelevant. Leonard doesn’t trim his nose hair. He thinks because he’s short nobody can see up there.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: My point is, Sheldon, the legal principle is ambiguity in a contract benefits the party that did not draft it, in this case, Leonard. So much for count one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But…

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: There’s no buts, Sheldon, that’s how the law works.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Schooled!

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: As for the shower capacity issue, I cite addendum J. When Sheldon showers second, any and all measures shall be taken to ensure an adequate supply of hot water. I believe this supercedes the occupancy issue.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Superceded!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This isn’t over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No offence, but shower sex with you is now the second best thing that’s happened today.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mmm, Greek food on pizza night? This is the most delightfully cruel thing we’ve done to Sheldon since we left that fake message from Stephen Hawking on his voice mail.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Howard (in Stephen Hawking voice)
utterance.content: I wish to discuss your theories of black holes. Meet me at the Randy’s Donut by the airport at 2:00 a.m.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is that you’re eating? Tonight is pizza night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d like to refer that to my attorney.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: According to what I see here, Thursday nights are Franconi’s pizza night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, and when Franconi’s went out of business, we switched to Graziano’s.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s interesting. Can you just switch restaurants like that, Priya?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: A good question, Howard. Turns out you can’t. According to the document you drew up, Sheldon, the selection of a new takeout restaurant requires public hearings and a 60-day comment period. Were those criteria met?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Opa!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is Greek food? Leonard, you hate Greek food.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not as much as you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. I’m nothing if not adaptable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I got you the lamb kabob.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. If you think about it, Greek food isn’t that far from italian food. They share a spice palette. And what a civilization is the Greeks. They gave us science, democracy, and little cubes of charred meat that taste like sweat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny? Penny? Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The mean Indian lady tried to make me eat lamb. Congratulations. Pizza night will now be at your apartment. Order one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry, honey, I’m meeting Amy and Bernadette for dinner. But you’re welcome to tag along.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A girls night? Oh, I don’t know if I’m up for an evening talking about rainbows, unicorns and menstrual cramps.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, suit yourself. We’ll probably be trashing Priya a little.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shotgun.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’d like to propose a toast to a wonderful girls night out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Fair warning, we can get ker-razy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. Last week we smoked cigars and pretended to be dragons.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really, Amy? Tobacco and alcohol? Need I remind you not a lot of scientific discoveries were made by people having a good time?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why did you bring him? He’s harshing my buzz.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I felt sorry for him. Priya’s giving him a hard time.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ooh, the Priya bashing’s starting early. Yay! Okay, what’s up with those pantsuits?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I need some context.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Pantsuits suck.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And that opens her up To justifiable ridicule for wearing them. Good one, Bernadette. See? Ker-razy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Whee-ee-ee!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You smell like baby powder.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s talc. But as that’s a primary ingredient of baby powder, I understand your confusion.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I’m not confused at all. You’re like a sexy toddler.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know how to process that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I do. Amy and Sheldon sitting in a tree. K-I-S-S-S-S-I-N-G.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s too many S’s for kissing.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Not if they’re doing it for a long time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, have you ever kissed a girl?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Other than my mother, my sister and my mee-maw, no. But in the interest of full disclosure, I was once on a bus and had to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation to an elderly nun who passed out from heat exhaustion. Every year I get a Christmas card from her, signed with far too many X’s and O’s.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That doesn’t count. Aren’t you even a little curious?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re a scientist, where is the curiosity?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m available for experimentation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Not necessary. We know everything there is to know about kissing. It requires 34 facial muscles and 112 postural muscles.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, blah, blah, blah. Give me some sugar, bestie .

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m certainly glad no one said they were curious about Aztec human sacrifice.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, I know, let’s take Sheldon dancing.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, I totally want to see Sheldon dance. I bet he looks like a spider on a hot plate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, thank you, but for the record, I’m an excellent dancer. Proficient in the rumba, waltz and cha-cha.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t see why that’s surprising. I excel at so many things. You’ve had my sourdough bread.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did you take dance lessons?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Against my will. In the South, pre-adolescent children are forced through a process called cotillion, which indoctrinates them with all the social graces and dance skills needed to function in 18th century Vienna.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, we are so taking you dancing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, you most certainly are not.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, what does your cotillion training say is expected of a gentleman when three ladies ask him to escort them to a dance soiree?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I saved a nun’s life. Why am I being punished?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Take us to a place we can waltz.

utterance.speaker: Taxi driver
utterance.content: Where you can what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Waltz. It’s a social dance from Austria, choreographed to a three-four time signature.

utterance.speaker: Taxi Driver
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Amy (singing)
utterance.content: I kissed a girl and I liked it, I hope my boyfriend don’t mind it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What happened to you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shake it baby, shake it!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Muy caliente, Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Elderly Korean Gentleman
utterance.content: Care to dance?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry, I’m engaged.

utterance.speaker: Korean
utterance.content: How about you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, what the hell. Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How come if we’re the smart people, we don’t do this every night?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s 16 times 14?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My burps taste like cranberry juice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And there’s your answer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Would you like to come in for a nightcap?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you’re referring to the beverage, you know I don’t drink. If you’re referring to the hat you don while wearing a nightshirt and holding a candle, I have one.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I have yoo-hoo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s hard to say no to yoo-hoo. The name literally beckons.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Make yourself comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Is someone smoking?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, that’s just Ricky.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You own a smoking monkey?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t be silly. He’s one of the animals in my department’s nicotine addiction study.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s he doing here?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m giving him emphysema. The least I can do is let him hang out and watch cable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Remarkable. Aren’t you worried about secondhand smoke?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: A little. The real danger is him biting my face off while I’m sleeping.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: is he deliberately blowing smoke at me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah. He’s kind of an ass.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. May I share something with you that’s troubling me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course. What’s rattling around that big bulbous brain of yours?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Priya has essentially nullified my roommate agreement with Leonard, making life in the apartment very uncomfortable for me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And you want me to kill her? Done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I trained Ricky how to smoke. I can train him to shoot a poison dart. No jury would convict us ’cause people love monkeys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I understand the alcohol has stirred up whatever it is that makes girls go wild, but I really need to talk to smart Amy now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Excuse me. Have you considered that your intelligence might be the very thing causing your dilemma?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What do you think Ricky over here would do if an interloper encroached on his territory?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, when challenged, monkeys generally assert their dominance through chasing, assault and a stylized penile display. That’s a little outside my comfort zone.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re being too literal. My point is, he would not meekly surrender to the rules, and neither should you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you suggesting I play dirty?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, dirty. Dirty, dirty, dirty. Which brings me to our next order of business.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I hope you don’t take what I’m about to do as a comment on what we just did.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (to Ricky)
utterance.content: Who’s to say you shouldn’t be dissecting our brains? You really are an ass.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Morning, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good, you’re up. I’ve written a new and improved roommate agreement that benefits me greatly. I’d like you to sign it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would I want to do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent question. Do you remember what happened to the alien, played by talented character actor Frank Gorshin, in the Star Trek episode Let That Be Your Last Battlefield?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, Captain Kirk activated the self-destruct sequence and threatened to blow up the Enterpriseand kill them both unless he gave in?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Affirmative. Computer, this is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Activate self-destruct sequence. Code 1-1-A-2-B.

utterance.speaker: Female Voice
utterance.content: Self-destruct sequence activated.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you gonna do, Sheldon, blow up the apartment?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That was my first thought, but all my cool stuff is here.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: So what happens when it counts down?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Unless Leonard signs the new agreement in the next 41 seconds, this computer will send an e-mail to your parents in India saying that you’re in a secret relationship with the whiter-than-marshmallow-fluff Leonard Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s the big deal?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Trust me, it’s a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They’re gonna find out about me eventually, right?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Yeah, of course, just not today.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: 20 seconds.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you ashamed of me?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Of course not.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then why can’t we tell your parents?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Please, don’t push this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He does that all the time, doesn’t he? 15.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Okay, fine, Sheldon, you win. Turn it off.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, he’s bluffing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I never bluff. Ten.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s blackmail!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nine.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: We give up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Eight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a laptop with a full charge. Honestly, what do you see in him?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Give him what he wants or we’re done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Three.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Two.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll sign it!

utterance.speaker: Female Voice
utterance.content: Self-destruct sequence aborted.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You may have gone to Cambridge, but I’m an honorary graduate of Starfleet academy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good morning, Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It most assuredly is not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you experiencing dehydration, headache, nausea and shame?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes. I also found a Korean man’s business card tucked into my cleavage. What happened last night?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, memory impairment, the free prize at the bottom of every vodka bottle.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Last night you gave me some excellent advice regarding my problem here at home, you kissed me and then vomited on and off for 40 minutes, following which you passed out on your bathroom floor. I then folded a towel under your head as a pillow, set your oven clock to the correct time because it was driving me crazy, and I left.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. Don’t really know where we go from here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suggest we treat our relationship as if it were a crashed computer and restore it to the last point we both agree it worked.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Terrific. Thank you. They were out of menthols! Get off my back! Not easy living with a temperamental little primate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (off)
utterance.content: Come on, Priya, just admit I embarrass you!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re preaching to the choir, sister.
